articles.title: Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Rangnang Sanitary Goods Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Rangnang Sanitary Goods Factory
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un gave field guidance to the Rangnang Sanitary Goods Factory.
					 The factory was inaugurated in April 2012 true to the behests of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Un said that his visit to the factory brings to his mind the day when he went round the sanitary goods branch factory newly built at the December 7 Factory accompanied by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Watching varieties of sanitary goods being churned out from the factory, Kim Jong Un noted that coming to his mind was tender-hearted smiling Kim Jong Il who was pleased that it became possible to provide the people and service personnel with quality sanitary goods.
					
					 He said that the officials and employees of the sanitary goods factory should convey to posterity with signal successes in production the love Kim Jong Il showed for the people by personally sending various samples of sanitary goods and taking a measure to build a sanitary goods factory.
					
					 He went round a products display room, sanitary goods production shop, packing room, science and technology disseminating room and other places to learn in detail about the production and management activities at the factory.
					
					 He expressed satisfaction over the fact that the factory has made achievements in producing the sanitary goods urgently needed for the living of the people and service personnel through a dynamic drive for carrying out the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 I was told that users of sanitary goods produced by the factory favor them, he said, adding that he was very pleased to hear such report.
					
					 The more highly  the users of the sanitary goods produced by the factory appreciate them, the deeper attention it should pay to what they require more,  he said, underlining the need to meticulously organize the work to increase varieties of sanitary goods favored by the people and service personnel. 
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that the officials and employees of the factory would turn it into the one which is loved by the people and serves them. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Yang Gon, Ri Jae Il, Kim Yo Jong and Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Secretary of C.C., WPK Meets Delegation of European Politicians
articles.content:
Secretary of C.C., WPK Meets Delegation of European Politicians
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with a delegation of politicians from various political parties of Europe headed by Chief Executive Officer of Inter Mediate Jonathan Powell, former Downing Street Chief of Staff to Prime Minister Tony Blair, on Tuesday.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets New Lao Ambassador
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets New Lao Ambassador
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Phonekham Inthaboualy, new Lao ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.

articles.title: Amnesty to Be Granted in DPRK
articles.content:
Amnesty to Be Granted in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK decided to grant an amnesty to the persons, who had been convicted of the crimes against the country and its people, on the occasion of the 70 anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The amnesty will take effect from Aug. 1.
					
					 The DPRK cabinet and relevant organs will take practical measures to help the released people settle down in their works and living.
					
					 The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK promulgated a decree in this regard on July 9.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Detaining DPRK Citizens
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Detaining DPRK Citizens
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean puppet regime perpetrated such crime against humanity as detaining three of five DPRK citizens who were adrift in the East Sea of Korea by accident.
					 As already known, the DPRK side sent notices to the south side several times, urging it to repatriate all the crewmen without delay, and their families strongly demanded a face-to-face interview with them.
					
					 However, the puppet regime has refused to send back three of them under absurd pretext of "defection."
					
					 In this regard, a spokesman for the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society made public a statement Tuesday, which branded the detention as an unpardonable grave encroachment on the sovereignty of the DPRK and the rights of its citizens and another hideous provocation.
					
					 In the past the DPRK sent back all south Korean fishermen and ships drifted toward its territorial waters, irrespective of reason and, in particular, it persuaded some of them eager to live in it to go back home, an expression of noble humanitarianism and compatriotism, the statement recalled, saying:
					
					 But the south Korean puppet group illegally detained citizens of the DPRK, forcing them to "defect", and refused even to provide data on their situation and arrange an interview with their families. This is a vivid expression of its rude act against human rights.
					
					 It is unjust and irritating that relatives are forced to separate from each other in peacetime, not in wartime.
					
					 Now the puppet group advertise about the "will to defect" in order to quell the public criticism and protest at home and abroad against the detaining of DPRK citizens. But it can never cover up the truth about its heinous crime against the nation and humanitarianism that violated even the elementary morality.
					
					 The "defection" farce is an extension of the group's persistent anti-DPRK policy getting more reckless day by day, and it is a deliberate and premeditated provocation to justify the story about someone's "instability of social system", impair the high prestige of the DPRK and worsen the north-south relations.
					
					 The puppet group should stop at once the anti-DPRK smear campaign precipitating its ruin and send back the illegally detained DPRK citizens without delay and any condition, clearly mindful of the catastrophic aftermath to be entailed by such provocation.

articles.title: Interview Takes Place at Panmunjom
articles.content:
Interview Takes Place at Panmunjom
 Panmunjom, July 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group of traitors committed another unpardonable heinous provocation wantonly violating the human rights of DPRK citizens.
					 On June 22 five DPRK residents went fishing aboard the fishing boat in the East Sea of Korea. But the boat drifted toward the area of the south side due to the worsening of weather condition and engine trouble.
					
					 In the morning of Tuesday the puppet group detained three of five DPRK residents and sent back two residents through Panmunjom.
					
					 Unable to meet their husband and sons, the families and their relatives staged a protest action at Panmunjom, enraged at the puppet group's human rights abuse.
					
					 There took place on the spot an interview with the families and relatives of the detained residents and those repatriated.
					
					  It is sheer nonsense that their kinsmen betrayed the DPRK, the families and relatives said, denouncing the puppet group for ruining the harmonious families and separating parents, wives and children while refusing to arrange even a face-to-face meeting with them.
					
					 The repatriated residents disclosed the fact that the puppet authorities segregated them from each other and made desperate efforts to force them to "defect" through allurement, blackmail, appeasement and deception, though they demanded an early repatriation to the DPRK where their kinsmen are eagerly waiting for them.
					
					 The families and relatives of the detained residents issued a written protest addressed to the south Korean authorities. 
					
					 It said that the "defection" of their dear kinsmen is an intrigue and fabrication cooked up by the south Korean authorities. 
					
					 With no rhetoric can the south Korean authorities justify their heinous crimes to separate from families those residents who suffered from unexpected disaster in peacetime, not in wartime, it charged.
					
					 If they have an iota of conscience and truly want national concord and reunification, they should send back the detained residents to their parents, wives and children immediately and unconditionally, it stressed.

articles.title: European Politicians Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
European Politicians Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of politicians from various political parties of Europe headed by Chief Executive Officer of Inter Mediate Jonathan Powell, former Downing Street Chief of Staff to Prime Minister Tony Blair, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Tuesday.
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 At the halls of immortality where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state they paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tour till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Youth and Students in Pyongyang Meet
articles.content:
Youth and Students in Pyongyang Meet
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A meeting of youth and students in Pyongyang City was held at the Youth Park Open-Air Theatre on Tuesday to vow to successfully glorify the 70th anniversary of the foundation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League as grand festival of youth of the great Paektusan nation.
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, made a report at the meeting to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that the 70 year-long history of the youth league is a proud one in which it performed brilliant feats for the country, people, era and history under the wise leadership of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 They referred to the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for the Korean youth movement.
					
					 They said:
					
					 The President regarded the youth movement as an important issue related to the future destiny of the country and nation in his early years, started his revolutionary activities from the youth movement and trained youth as the powerful vanguard rank of the revolution and the reliable reserves of the party by successfully embodying the original idea of attaching importance to the youth.
					
					 Kim Jong Il who carried forward the said idea of the President handed the youth the torch of the revolution and developed the youth league into the most dignified and powerful youth organization in the world which is going by the august name of the sun.
					
					 The Korean youth movement which has glorified its proud history and tradition under the care of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il is ushering in a greatest heyday of its development as it is led by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They underlined the need to build the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station as a monumental edifice of the youth and successfully adorn the grand festival venue in October with proud labor gift of the young vanguard to the party.
					
					 An appeal to the youth league organizations and youth across the country was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 The appeal underscored the need to always straightly and more dynamically advance to successfully glorify the 70th anniversary of the foundation of the youth league as the grand festival of youth of the great Paektusan nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present at the meeting were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of the youth league and youth and students in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Signal Successes Achieved in Environmental Protection
articles.content:
Signal Successes Achieved in Environmental Protection
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has paid big efforts to protecting environment.
					 In this regard, Kim Yong Chol, department director of the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection, told KCNA that the DPRK government has made signal successes in environmental protection over the past 10 years.
					
					 He said:
					
					 A series of laws on environmental protection were enacted in the country, making it possible to supervise environmental protection in a unified way with an increasing number of observation posts set up throughout the country.
					
					 Industrial establishments have given priority to removing harmful gas and dust and purifying waste water. And strides have been made in afforesting villages, streets and working places.
					
					 In the near future, a real-time system for observing the environmental change would be set up on a countrywide scale.
					
					 The DPRK has pushed ahead with the building of environment-friendly economy.

articles.title: Brew of Makkoli, Cultural Heritage of Korea
articles.content:
Brew of Makkoli, Cultural Heritage of Korea
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The brew of makkoli (unrefined liquor) is one of the national intangible heritages in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 From olden times, Koreans used to take this traditional drink in hot summer.
					
					Makkoli with a long history is usually made from starch-containing crops and yeast, and it is diverse in variety and brewing.
					
					 This drink has various nutrients with peculiar taste and aroma. Its alcoholic content is under 10 percent and sugar content 2-4 percent.
					
					 It is considered to be good for treatment of such diseases as diabetes, myocardial infraction and arteriosclerosis.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S., S. Korean Puppet Forces of Their Smear Campaign against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S., S. Korean Puppet Forces of Their Smear Campaign against DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- An American researcher styling himself an "expert on north Korea's affairs" in a recent "meet-the press" blared that production facilities of the Pyongyang Bio-technical Institute is "similar to those for producing anthrax germs" and "processes for producing agro-chemicals are similar to those for producing anthrax germs." He talked rubbish that "the institute hints the north is capable of producing anthrax germs." YTN, KBS and other puppet conservative media of south Korea are joining him in false propaganda, claiming that "there is some sense."
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says the smear campaign conducted by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces is a disgusting one of confrontation maniacs seized by repugnancy and hostility toward the DPRK.
					
					 It is also a cynic political intrigue to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK and fan up the international atmosphere for stifling it, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Pyongyang Bio-technical Institute is nothing to do with anthrax germs as it is a scientific research and production base for bio-agricultural chemicals used for exterminating vermin insects of crops.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean puppet forces are pulling up the DPRK once again, a crafty scheme to cover up their attempt at igniting a germ warfare and divert elsewhere the attention of the public at home and abroad.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms U.S. Wrecker of Peace in Europe
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms U.S. Wrecker of Peace in Europe
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- U.S. Secretary of Defense Carter, when visiting European countries some days ago, opened to public the U.S. plan to deploy heavy weapons including tanks, armored vehicles and artillery pieces in those countries which belonged to the former Soviet Union and other East European countries. And he said the U.S. would render all kinds of aids to the European countries so that they may stand against Russia. 
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this is little short of openly revealing the U.S. intention to concentrically increase and deploy armed forces near the border of Russia in a bid to hold military edge and contain it by force of arms. The news analyst goes on:
					
					 Russia and the U.S. are going over to practical military actions which may lead to physical conflict at any time.
					
					 Such grave situation in Europe is attributable to the U.S. strategy against Russia.
					
					 The strategy is aimed at retaining military domination over Central Asia and Mid-east and drawing the East European countries into NATO in a bid to lay a military siege to Russia.
					
					 If the confrontation structure between Russia and the U.S. is getting more serious and a physical conflict occurs, the whole of Europe may be engulfed in a war and it may go over to a world war.
					
					 World war should never be repeated as it will bring monstrous disasters to mankind. This is the unanimous desire of the world peace-loving progressive people.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities for Escalating Confrontation with DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities for Escalating Confrontation with DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The north-south relations are still in the worst catastrophic situation despite ardent desire and efforts of Koreans. This is attributable to the south Korean puppet authorities' policy for escalating confrontation with compatriots in the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in an article. It goes on:
					
					 It is impossible to improve the north-south relations and open the way of peace and reunification if they are allowed to pursue the policy of confrontation.
					
					 In order to hold dialogue between the north and the south and improve their relations, it is necessary to refrain from any provocation against the other side, to begin with.
					
					 However, the puppet group of traitors is talking about "dialogue" but, in actuality, resorting to the sinister provocations to hurt the socialist system of the dignified DPRK and realize the ambition for "unification of social systems".
					
					 It staged a farce of hosting the UN "office on human rights in the north" in Seoul defying the unanimous denunciation and rejection of the whole nation.
					
					 It is building up public opinions at home and abroad about the issue of the non-existent "human rights in the north" and justifying and escalating confrontation with the DPRK under this pretext in a bid to do harm to it.
					
					 Its confrontation policy is a war policy increasing the danger of a nuclear war while disturbing peace and stability on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It is keen on the arms buildup for invading the north by pushing forward the deployment of THAAD in south Korea in secrecy and purchasing air tankers from overseas. It is also stepping up military nexus with Japan, buoyed by the ambition for reinvasion with the U.S. backing.
					
					 The present situation goes to clearly prove that the north-south relations can never be mended as long as the south Korean puppet authorities do not cancel the policy for escalating confrontation with compatriots in the DPRK and stop the provocations against it.

articles.title: Minju Joson Urges Japan to Make Apology and Reparation for Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Minju Joson Urges Japan to Make Apology and Reparation for Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A list of Korean draftees, who were taken to Sakhalin for forced labor by Japanese imperialists, were discovered recently.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday says this proves that the crimes against humanity committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past are a stark truth of history which can be neither concealed nor denied with anything.
					
					 The despicable behavior of the Japanese reactionaries to deny such historic facts and cover up the crime-woven past history is a heinous insult to not only the victims but the whole Korean nation and a foolish act of bringing about their own ruin, the news analyst notes, and goes on:
					
					 Japan has not yet stop such foolish act as digging its own grave while denying the crime-woven past history, not coming to its senses.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are scheming to make Japan's society veer to the ultra Right and turn itself into a militarist state, deliberately embellishing the heinous past crimes stained with blood, buoyed by the ambition for militarist overseas expansion.
					
					 Their denial and distortion of history and evasion of reparation for the past crimes is leading Japan to ruin.
					
					 They should honestly admit the past crimes and make an apology and reparation for them in a responsible manner.
					
					 This is the only way out for Japan.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on S. Korean Regime's Refusal to Send Back DPRK Citizens
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on S. Korean Regime's Refusal to Send Back DPRK Citizens
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces have refused to repatriate three of five DPRK citizens who had been adrift due to an unexpected accident in the East Sea of Korea short time ago, talking about "defection."
					 This is an unpardonable infringement upon the sovereignty of the DPRK and the right of its citizens and another hideous provocation against it.
					
					 As the puppet group did not repatriate all of them, rubbing salt into wound of their family members, they fell into swoon while demanding a face-to-face meeting with their family members at Panmunjom.
					
					 In the past the DPRK sent back all south Korean fishermen and ships drifted toward its territorial waters, whatever the reason may be. In particular, it persuaded south Koreans eager to live in it to go back south Korea, an expression of noble humanitarianism and compatriotism.
					
					 Such hostile act against crewmen of a drifting ship was not unexpectedly committed by a few individual military gangsters but under tacit support of the puppet authorities. 
					
					 In the past period the puppet group frequently detained DPRK residents, conducting illegal and forcible "defection" campaigns.
					
					 It has formed a "joint investigation team" with the Intelligence Service, the Ministry of Unification, the military and police involved and worked hard to force DPRK residents drifted due to unexpected accidents to "defect" through persistent threat, appeasement and deception in bid to use them as hostages for anti-DPRK smear campaign.
					
					 The detaining of DPRK residents by the puppet group this time is an extension of its heinous confrontation racket against the DPRK.
					
					 It is unhesitatingly kicking off deliberate and premeditated provocation to tarnish the image of the DPRK and drive the inter-Korean relations into more catastrophic phase.
					
					 The puppet group should stop at once the anti-DPRK racket precipitating its ruin and immediately and unconditionally send back DPRK residents detained unreasonably.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Opposes U.S. Moves to Deploy THAAD
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Opposes U.S. Moves to Deploy THAAD
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on July 10 as part of peace action which started on July 9 to oppose the U.S. moves to deploy THAAD, according to the south Korean internet paper Thongil News.
					 The deployment of THAAD was prompted by a politically-motivated purpose of the U.S. and Japan to bind south Korea to their alliance forever, the organization said.
					
					 It urged the authorities to immediately clarify their stand against the deployment of THAAD in south Korea.

articles.title: Truth behind Japan's Past Crimes Disclosed
articles.content:
Truth behind Japan's Past Crimes Disclosed
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Yonhap News of south Korea issued an article on July 12 disclosing the past crimes of the Japanese imperialists. 
					 The article said:
					
					 As regards "forced labor by Koreans" which was reflected in the written decision on registering modern industrial facilities as world cultural heritages, Japan overruled it, claiming that "Japan did not admit the forced labor". Against this backdrop, a record was discovered that wire entanglements were set up at a Japanese coal mine in those days to prevent Koreans' escape.
					
					 This being a hard reality, no sooner had modern industrial facilities including Koreans' forced labor sites been registered as world's cultural heritages than the Japanese government claimed that it did not admit the forced labor.
					
					 This fully revealed the Japanese authorities' assertion that Japanese imperialists' aggression and colonial domination were legal and cognition of the distorted history.

articles.title: U.S. Moves for Germ Warfare Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Moves for Germ Warfare Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The People's Action for Peace against War, the Civic and Public Measure Council for Denouncing Illegal Introduction and Experiments of Anthrax Germs and the Phyongthaek Citizens Action for Checking U.S. Forces' Introduction and Experiments of Bio-chemical Weapons in south Korea held a rally outside the Osan U.S. air force base on July 11 to denounce the moves of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces to prepare a germ warfare.
					 Speakers called upon all people to wage action to get the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea and make an independent reunified world.
					
					 Then, the participants staged a demonstration.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in DR Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in DR Congo
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" was brought out in booklet by the Cedi Publishing House of DR Congo.
					 The work published on April 20, Juche 101 (2012) deals with the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il all their lives. It also indicates the tasks for firmly defending the idea and exploits of the President and Kim Jong Il and adding shine to them forever.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony took place at the National Committee of DR Congo for the Study of the Juche Idea on July 8.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Personage of DR Congo
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Personage of DR Congo
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- It is the most sacred duty of the world progressives to hold President Kim Il Sung, who added shine to the 20th century, in high esteem as the sun of humankind.
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, chairman of the National Committee of DR Congo for the Study of the Juche Idea, said this at the ceremony of releasing supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work held in DR Congo on July 8.
					
					 He noted that the President dedicated himself to building a socialist state where the people became the master, free from exploitation and oppression.
					
					 Though the President passed away, the Juche idea founded by him is shedding its rays as the guiding idea of the progressives aspiring after independence, he added.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- There took place events in different countries in commemoration of the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 A seminar was held in Finland, photo exhibition in Mongolia and round-table talks in Angola on July 7 and 8. 
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting the exploits of the President, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and their works.
					
					 The international secretary of the Finnish Communists' League and other speakers highly praised the President as the outstanding thinker and theoretician who founded the immortal Juche idea and indicated the way to be followed by mankind, invincible and iron-willed commander who defeated U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation and elder statesman of the world who made great contributions to the global cause of independence. 
					
					 A vice-director of the Mongolian Ulan Bator Carpet Company said the President was the great man recognized by the world. 
					
					 A department director of the Special Project Room of the Presidency of Angola and other speakers said diverse political and cultural events are being held worldwide one after another in praise of the career and exploits of the President on the occasion of the anniversary of his demise (July 8). This proves that he is boundlessly revered by mankind though he passed away, they added. 
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar held in Finland.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Observed in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Meetings for remembering President Kim Il Sung took place in Finland, Germany, Nepal and Uganda from July 4 to July 8.
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos dealing with the revolutionary career and exploits of the President and the revolutionary activities of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were works of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu and books and photos introducing the Korean army and people conducting the general offensive for the final victory.
					
					 The chairman of the Paektu Association of Finland said that the President was the outstanding leader of the world socialist movement who encouraged the progressives aspiring after independence.
					
					 A vice-chairman of the Federal Republic of Germany-DPRK Association said that the President worked heart and soul to bring happiness to the people and reunify the country.
					
					 The chairman of the Nepali national committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and other speakers said that the President was the most outstanding leader in the 20th century and the world elder statesman who led to victory the liberation of the country, building of a new country and socialist construction and rendered great service to ensuring global peace and security.
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings in Finland and Nepal.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Cuba, Serbia, Iran
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Cuba, Serbia, Iran
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- There took place meetings for remembering President Kim Il Sung in Cuba, Serbia and Iran on July 6.
					 The first vice-chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting the Reunification of Korea said that victorious and glorious history of the DPRK would be unthinkable apart from the President.
					
					 The President energetically worked to realize the ideal and dream of the people till the last moments of his life, possessed of boundless love for them, the first vice-chairman said, and went on:
					
					 Though the President passed away, his tender-hearted image will be kept forever in the hearts of not only the Korean people but the world progressives.
					
					 The general secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party of Serbia paid high tribute to the President. He said:
					
					 The President was not only an invincible and iron-willed commander and outstanding strategist who embarked upon the road of the revolution in his early years and defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists but also the world elder statesman who made immortal contributions to the human cause of independence.
					
					 The president of the International Taekwon-Do Association in Iran noted that Kim Il Sung dedicated himself to the happiness of the Korean people, prosperity of the country and the cause of global independence.  
					
					 We will always remember the feats of Kim Il Sung, he added.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Indian Papers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Indian Papers
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Indian papers carried articles to observe the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Awaking on July 3 said that the President was not only the leader of a country but also the great father taking care of the people. It went on:
					
					 He found his pleasure in dedicating himself to the people all his life.
					
					 When recollecting the President, the father of the people, coming to one's mind is the image of him among children.
					
					 Indian and World Event on July 6 noted:
					
					 Coming across one's mind before anything else when recollecting the President is his tender-hearted beaming image. He always took warm care of the people with a broad smile on his face. It was the fragrance peculiar to the President as a great man.
					
					 He was highly praised by many party and state leaders and prominent personages in the world. This was because his idea and leadership were outstanding and he had distinguished traits attracting all people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Introduced by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Introduced by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign media commemorated the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 La Prosperite, the paper of DR Congo, on June 29 allotted one whole page to articles illustrated with the portrait of the smiling President.
					
					 The paper said that the august name of the President, the sun of the 20th century, is shining along with the exploits he performed for socialist construction in the DPRK and the cause of human independence.
					
					 The May-June issue of an Egyptian magazine carried an article illustrated with the portrait of the smiling President.
					
					 The magazine said that the President founded the immortal Juche idea, brightly indicated the road to be followed by humankind and took warm care of all people.
					
					 The Cambodian FM 90.5 Radio and Apsara TV and Radio Broadcasting Service on June 24 and 25 praised the President as a peerlessly great man, outstanding elder statesman and the sun who founded the guiding idea in the era of independence, made immortal contributions to the cause of global independence with his extraordinary leadership and attracted all people with his noble benevolence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige Fabrica de Articulos Sanitarios de Raknang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige Fabrica de Articulos Sanitarios de Raknang
Pyongyang, 14 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un dirigio en el terreno la Fabrica de Articulos Sanitarios de Raknang, levantada en abril de 2012 en acato al legado del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					El Mariscal dijo que la fabrica le hace recordar el dia en que recorria junto con el Dirigente Kim Jong Il el taller anexo de articulos sanitarios construido nuevamente en la Fabrica 7 de Diciembre y agrego que le viene a la memoria la imagen sonriente del Dirigente quien viendo varios articulos de buena calidad que salian a chorro se mostraba tan satisfecho por poder suministrarlos al pueblo y los militares.
					
					Subrayo que los funcionarios y los empleados de la fabrica deben transmitir para siempre con los exitos laborales el amor por el pueblo del Dirigente quien tomo las medidas necesarias para construir la fabrica de articulos sanitarios, luego de enviar las muestras de articulos modelos de varios tipos.
					
					Pasando revista a la sala de exhibicion de articulos, el taller de produccion de articulos sanitarios, la sala de embalaje, la de divulgacion de ciencias y tecnicas y otros lugares, el Mariscal hizo detallado conocimiento de la marcha de produccion y gestion de la fabrica.
					
					Mostro satisfaccion de que la fabrica alcanza los exitos en la produccion de los articulos inminentemente necesarios para la vida del pueblo y de los militares al empenarse por  materializar el legado del Dirigente.
					
					Destaco que el mismo se siente muy contento al recibir tal informacion de que los articulos hechos en la fabrica gozan de buena reputacion de los usuarios.
					
					Tanto mas que los articulos ganen reputaciones de los usuarios, deben prestar oidos a que demandan mas ellos, senalo y refirio la necesidad de organizar con escrupulosidad los trabajos para aumentar las variedades de los productos a que prefieren los habitantes y los militares.
					
					Expreso la esperanza de que los funcionarios y los empleados conviertan la fabrica en una empresa amada por el pueblo y que sirva para el pueblo.
					
					Le acompanaron Kim Yang Gon, Ri Jae Il, Kim Yo Jong y Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: RPDC concedera amnistia a delincuentes
articles.content:
RPDC concedera amnistia a delincuentes
Pyongyang, 14 de julio (ACNC) -- En ocasion del 70o aniversario de la liberacion de la patria y de la fundacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea decidio conceder la amnistia a quienes fueron sentenciados por haber cometido los crimenes ante la patria y el pueblo.
					La amnistia se aplicara desde el dia primero de agosto.
					
					El Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC y otros organos correspondientes tomaran las medidas practicas para que las personas a ponerse en libertad por la amnistia realicen una vida y trabajo estables.
					
					Quedo publicado el dia 9 el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC.

articles.title: ACR denuncia atrocidad antietica de titeres surcoreanos
articles.content:
ACR denuncia atrocidad antietica de titeres surcoreanos
Pyongyang, 14 de julio (ACNC) -- La banda titere surcoreana cometio la barbaridad inhumanitaria de retener a fuerza a 3 de entre 5 habitantes de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea naufragados hace poco por un accidente inesperado en el Mar Este de Corea.
					Como trascendidos, desde cuando nuestros tripulantes pasaron a la zona maritima surcoreana por el naufragio, la RPDC envio en varias ocasiones la nota de aviso demandando devolverlos a donde les esperan sus padres, esposas e hijos y  sus familiares exigieron fuertemente las entrevistas personales con sus maridos e hijos.
					
					Sin embargo, los titeres surcoreanos negaron la devolucion de 3 tripulantes bajo el pretexto de que ellos expresaron la  voluntad de "sumision".
					
					En su declaracion publicada hoy, el portavoz del Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea condeno que los crimenes antieticos cometidos esta vez por la banda titere devienen una grave violacion de los derechos humanos de los habitantes de la RPDC y otra provocacion extremada contra esta y prosiguio:
					
					En los tiempos pasados, sin tomar en consideracion el motivo, devolvimos a los pesqueros y los barcos surcoreanos que entraron en nuestra zona. En particular, mostramos el noble humanitarismo y compatriotismo de persuadir y devolver a los habitantes surcoreanos que solicitaban ansiosamente vivir en la RPDC a la parte surcoreana donde viven sus familias y parientes.
					
					Pero, insatisfecha con retener a los habitantes norcoreanos al imponerles la ilegitima y coercitiva farsa de "sumision", la banda titere cometio sin vacilacion alguna la actitud bandidesca anti-DDHH de negar la demanda de los datos personales de ellos y la entrevista con sus familiares.
					
					Es inimaginable y lamentable el hecho de que imponen la separacion forzosa de los familiares consanguineos no en el periodo de guerra sino en el pacifico.
					
					Ahora, los compinches titeres hablan de la "voluntad de sumision" para apaciguar las criticas internas y externas y las opiniones de condena dirigidas a ellos mismos. Pero jamas encubriran la verdad de sus crimenes antinacionales e inhumanitarios de haber pisoteado hasta la elemental etica.
					
					La presente retencion es la continuacion de sus connotados alborotos conflictivos anti-RPDC. Ademas constituye la provocacion intencional y planificada para difamar el alto prestigio de la RPDC y llevar a la fase catastrofica las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos deben tener bien presente que sus imprudencias causaran la consecuencia devastadora, renunciar inmediatamente las campanas intrigantes anti-RPDC que aceleraran solamente su autodestruccion y devolver incondicionalmente a los habitantes de la RPDC retenidos injustamente.

articles.title: Se concede entrevista de repatriados y familiares y parientes de retenidos
articles.content:
Se concede entrevista de repatriados y familiares y parientes de retenidos
Phanmunjom, 14 de julio (ACNC) -- Los titeres surcoreanos cometieron otra atrocidad provocativa intolerable de violar seriamente los derechos humanos de los ciudadanos de la RPDC.
					El pasado dia 22 de junio, 5 ciudadanos de la RPDC, quienes salieron con el barco al Mar Este para la pesca, fueron derivados hacia la region surcoreana por el empeoramiento climatico y la averia del barco.
					
					Por la manana del dia 14, los titeres surcoreanos devolvieron por via de Phanmunjom solo a 2 personas y detuvieron los restos.
					
					Los familiares y parientes esperaban contando con los dedos el tiempo de encontrarse con sus consanguineos. Pero, cuando no se veian sus maridos e hijos, llamaron en voz alta a ellos y desplegaron la lucha de protesta en Phanmunjom con la vehemente indignacion  por los crimenes anti-DDHH de la banda titere.
					
					Tuvo lugar en el terreno la entrevista de los repatriados y los familiares y parientes de los retenidos.
					
					Los familiares y los parientes senalaron que no pueden creer en que sus consanguineos hayan traicionado a su patria RPDC. Y condenaron los alborotos inhumanitarios de los compinches titeres que negaron la confirmacion mediante el contacto directo de los familiares, destruyeron las familias armoniosas y separaron a fuerza a las familias.
					
					Los repatriados revelaron las viles maquinaciones de las autoridades titeres que les aislaron entre si y se enfrascaron en lograr la "sumision" de los naufragados con la seduccion, chantaje, conciliacion y el engano aunque los naufragados demandaron su devolucion a la RPDC.
					
					Los familiares y parientes de los retenidos hicieron publica una nota de protesta a las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					La nota denuncia que la "sumision" de sus amados consanguineos es un falso inventado a fuerza por las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					Anade que jamas seran justificados los actos criminales de separar de sus familiares a las personas que sufrieron accidentalmente las calamidades no en el tiempo belico sino en el pacifico.
					
					Asevera que si tienen un pedacillo de la conciencia y desean de veras la reconciliacion y reunificacion nacionales, las autoridades surcoreanas deben devolver incondicionalmente a los retenidos al regazo de sus familiares.
